## Context

We aim at detecting pathological athletes during an altitude training camp. To do so we used urine sample analysed by NMR. Here we try different model to detect the pathological samples to determine which one is the best.

```{r Config, include=FALSE}
set.seed(42)
library(tidyverse)
library(data.table)
library(knitr)
library(janitor)
library(psych)
library(kableExtra)
library(caret)
library(factoextra)
library(cluster)
library(ggfortify)
library(magrittr)
source("functions.R")
```

# Data description

```{r}
antrop_data <- fread(input = "Data/Subjects.csv") |>
  clean_names() |>
  select(c("age", "height", "weight"))
describe(x = antrop_data, na.rm = T) |>
  round() |> 
  select(c("mean", "sd", "median", "min", "max")) |> 
  kable(caption = paste0(
      "<center><strong>Anthropological values (n = ",
      nrow(antrop_data),
      ")</center></strong>"
    )) 
  # kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped"), full_width = FALSE)
```

# Pre-processing

Pre-processing was done using [npflow](https://nmrprocflow.org).

```{r}
data_pre_post <- fread(input = "Data/data_Patho_pre_day.csv") |> 
  column_to_rownames(var = "Samplecode") |> 
  mutate_at(c(2:237), \(x) scale(x)) |> 
  lapply(as.numeric) |> 
  as.data.frame()

data_rand <- fread(input = "Data/data_Patho_rand.csv") |> 
  column_to_rownames(var = "Samplecode") |> 
  mutate_at(c(2:380), \(x) scale(x)) |>
  lapply(as.numeric) |> 
  as.data.frame()
```

# Pre-post comparison

We compare data from the first day with data from the day symptoms were observed. Do not forget that the subjects are training in altitude and an effect of chronic hypoxic exposure can be observed.

```{r KM_PP}
km_res <- kmeans(x = data_pre_post, centers = 2)
km_cluster <- km_res$cluster - 1
confusionMatrix(km_cluster |> as.factor(), data_pre_post$Patho |> as.factor()) |> draw_confusion_matrix()
fviz_cluster(object = km_res, data = data_pre_post)
```

```{r HC_PP}
hc_res <- agnes(data_pre_post, method = "ward")
confusionMatrix(hc_res |> cutree(k = 2) |> subtract(e1 = 1) |> as.factor(), data_pre_post$Patho |> as.factor()) |> draw_confusion_matrix()
hclust_plot(clust_data = hc_res, target = data_pre_post$Patho)
```

```{r PCA_PP}
pca_res <- prcomp(x = data_pre_post)
pca_scores <- data.frame(pca_res$x[, 1:2])
# confusionMatrix(pca_scores |> kmeans(centers = 2) %$% cluster - 1 |> as.factor(), data_pre_post$Patho |> as.factor()) |> draw_confusion_matrix()
autoplot(
  object = pca_res,
  data = data_pre_post,
  color = "Patho",
  loadings = TRUE,
  loadings.label = TRUE,
  loadings.label.size = 3,
  frame = TRUE,
  frame.type = 'norm'
)
```

```{r PLS-DA_PP}
pls_res <- ropls::opls(data_pre_post, data_pre_post$Patho)
# confusionMatrix(pls_res |> as.factor(), data_pre_post$Patho |> as.factor()) |> draw_confusion_matrix()
```

# Random comparison

We compare data from pathological subjects with data from non pathological ones on the same day to avoid differences induced by the hypoxic exposure.

```{r KM_R}
km_res <- kmeans(x = data_rand, centers = 2)
km_cluster <- km_res$cluster - 1
confusionMatrix(km_cluster |> as.factor(), data_rand$Patho |> as.factor()) |> draw_confusion_matrix()
fviz_cluster(object = km_res, data = data_rand)
```

```{r HC_R}
hc_res <- agnes(data_rand, method = "ward")
confusionMatrix(hc_res |> cutree(k = 2) |> subtract(e1 = 1) |> as.factor(), data_rand$Patho |> as.factor()) |> draw_confusion_matrix()
hclust_plot(clust_data = hc_res, target = data_rand$Patho)
```

```{r PCA_R}

# confusionMatrix(pca_res |> as.factor(), data_rand$Patho |> as.factor()) |> draw_confusion_matrix()

```
